com.hush.pgp
Class Signature

java.lang.Object
  com.hush.pgp.Signable
      com.hush.pgp.Signature
All Implemented Interfaces:
PgpConstants, java.io.Serializable
public class Signature
extends Signable
implements PgpConstants

A class to create and verify PGP signatures.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Loads one or more detached signatures from a stream.
The signatures may be armored or unarmored *

in - the stream from which the signature is loaded

load

public static Signature[] load(java.io.InputStream in,
                               java.lang.String defaultCharacterEncoding,
                               boolean overrideHeaderCharacterEncoding)
                        throws DataFormatException,
                               java.io.IOException
Loads one or more detached signatures from a stream. Character encodings only matter if you will be passing strings into the update calls. For bytes, it won't matter.
The signatures may be armored or unarmored *

Parameters:
in - the stream from which the signature is loaded
the - default character encoding to use if no character encoding is found in the signature headers
even - if a character encoding is found in the headers, override it with the default
Throws:
DataFormatException
java.io.IOException

finishSigning

public void finishSigning(java.security.SecureRandom random)
Finish the signature creation procedure.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if signing is not in progress
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the public key algorithm is not supported

finishVerification

public void finishVerification(Key publicKey)
                        throws InvalidSignatureException
Finished the signature verification procedure.

Parameters:
publicKey - the key with which to verify the signature.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if signing is not in progress
InvalidSignatureException - if the signature verification fails
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the public key algorithm is not supported

public long getCreationTime(boolean definitive)
Returns the signature creation time from the hashed section of the packet. Returns -1 if not specified.
RFC 2440 5.2.3.4 ( 5.2.2 for V3 signatures )

definitive - required the data to be signed

Sets this signature on a user ID to specify the primary user ID for the key.
RFC 2440 5.2.3.19

Parameters:
isPrimaryUserID - set to true if this is the primary user ID
definitive - sign the data
critical - must be recognized by recipient software

Parameters:

startSigning

public void startSigning(Key secretKey,
                         int signatureType)
                  throws UnrecoverableKeyException
Starts the signature creation procedure.
This will clear any existing issuer and creation time subpackets first.

Parameters:
secretKey - the key that will be used to generate the signature.
signatureType - the type of signature to be generated.
secretKey - the key that will be used to generate the signature.
signatureType - the type of signature to be generated.
Throws:
PgpException - if the secret key has not been decrypted.
UnrecoverableKeyException

                         int signatureType,

                  throws UnrecoverableKeyException

This will clear any existing issuer and creation time subpackets first.

                         int signatureType,
                         long creationTime)

update

public void update(java.lang.String data)
Updates the signature with the given data, converting it to bytes according to the character encoding set by setCharacterEncoding(String).
If you make multiple calls to this method, be sure that each string ends in a newline.

Parameters:
data - the data for the update.
